p: Surgical management is usually not required in adenoviral keratoconjunctivitis; however, it may be necessary in cases of significant fibrotic remodeling of the conjunctiva or sustained corneal scarring with visual consequence. Membranes that develop on the mucosal surface can be differentiated into pseudomembranes or true membranes, with the latter being clinically distinguished by induced bleeding upon denuding. 1
